Package server

Class GameClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.GameClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, ServerProtocol
    public class GameClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, ServerProtocol
    Represents the communication with a client. Each client has its own game client handler thread that handles the communication. This class listens and writes messages. So it also implements the server protocol that makes sure all communication is by the protocol. Furthermore, it handles the messages which means that it communicates with the game instance this client is a part of. Both the game calls methods from this class and this class calls method of game. Hence it is a middle man between the client and the game.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread that continuously listens to client input and forwards the input to the handleCommand(String) method.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • handleCommand

        public void handleCommand​(java.lang.String input)
                   throws ProtocolException
        Handles client sent input and calls the respective methods to handle the task related to the message.
        Parameters:
        input - the String input to handle.
        Throws:
        ProtocolException - when the input provided by client doesnt abide the protocol.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove()
        This method is called by the game when it's this clients move. It creates a 30 second timer and if the respective client doesn't send their move in time, then this timer makes the move for them. The move is marked as late so even though it includes valid coordinates, they are not actually taken into account by the game.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for this player's name
        Returns:
        This threads client's name.

      • getSocket

        public java.net.Socket getSocket()
        Getter for the socket connection. Used for determining whether client has disconnected.
        Returns:
        The socket.

      • handleHello

        public void handleHello​(java.lang.String playerName)
        Handles the handshake sent in by the client. Checks whether the name included is not already taken in the game, if it isn't then sets that name in the game, if it is then sends back ServerProtocol.nameExists().
        Specified by:
        handleHello in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name submitted by the client in the handshake.

      • nameExists

        public void nameExists()
        When client tries to connect but in handshake includes the same name as the opponent. This methods sends back message informing the client of that.
        Specified by:
        nameExists in interface ServerProtocol

      • enemyName

        public void enemyName​(java.lang.String playerName)

        Specified by:
        enemyName in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        playerName - The opponents name.

      • clientBoard

        public void clientBoard​(java.lang.String encodedBoard)
        Receives the encoded version of client's game board and sets it in the game. The setter method in the game takes care of decoding the board.
        Specified by:
        clientBoard in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        encodedBoard - The encoded game board sent in by the client.

      • gameSetup

        public void gameSetup​(java.lang.String playerName)
        Sends out to clients the name of the player that has the first move in the game. Also starts the move timer for the player that has the first move.
        Specified by:
        gameSetup in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player that goes first.

      • move

        public void move​(int x,
                 int y)
        A move that the client makes. This method then make the respective move in the game and also cancels the timer that was set for the move.
        Specified by:
        move in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the move.
        y - The Y coordinate of the move

      • update

        public void update​(int x,
                   int y,
                   boolean isHit,
                   boolean isSunk,
                   boolean isLate,
                   java.lang.String lastPlayerName,
                   java.lang.String nextPlayerName)
        Method to update both clients after one of them has made a move.
        Specified by:
        update in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the move made
        y - the Y coordinate of the move made
        isHit - indicates whether move was a hit on a ship
        isSunk - indicates whether move sunk a whole ship
        isLate - indicates whether the previos move was a late move
        lastPlayerName - The name of the player that made the move
        nextPlayerName - The name of the player that should make the next move

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver​(java.lang.String playerName,
                     boolean winType)
        Method that informs clients when game ends. This could happen if 5 minutes pass, someone sinks all of opponent's ships or one of the clients disconnects.
        Specified by:
        gameOver in interface ServerProtocol
        Parameters:
        playerName - Of the winner, or empty string if it's a tie.
        winType - indicates what kind of end it was in the game. True: if game ended normally, false if one of the players quit.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        When of the players wish to exit this method informs the game about it and shuts down communication with the client.
        Specified by:
        exit in interface ServerProtocol
